I have a recyclerview with rows containing 4 edittexts, name, email, company, position. When i change the edittexts, their contents is written to an object, which it rebuilds from if necessary/invalidated. I am trying to accomplish the company name cascading downwards in the list, getting copied on the following rows, but I can’t really find anywhere to notify the changes without getting IllegalStateException (can’t invalidate while computing layout or scrolling). Running out of ideas, anyone have any suggestions?
Can someone confirm that if I grant camera permissions, that the camera is able to write the image to the device, even if I've not given file permissions?
its a hardware access permission
writing to disk will be separate permission
Thats what I thought
But I'm providing a uri to the camera intent and it's saving the image to the device
(at the uri)
well if you opening the default camera app then i guess not required
Hmm I guess so
there are different way you use camera
Yeah I'm just launching default (or user selected) at the moment
yup then i think you are right
as the default camera app will have permission to write already
The other side is that the app is still reading from the file correctly after the fact though haha
Would've thought some permissions would be needed there
Oh well, learning new things about permissions erryday I guess
in theory its right way to do like that... as easy work for developer
Yeah, just would've thought permissions would be required to read from the file system
Either that or possibly permissions are required to read outside of a specific directory in the file system, which would make more sense
e.g. Can read whatever you want from the app's directory, but need permissions to read from say the facebook app's directory

Struggling with DI a bit, I thought providing a Singleton instance inside my singleton application module, would share the same variables everywhere ? It seems that it resets them each time I inject
did you annotate it @Singleton?
Yes
did you annotate the component as well?
Yes
@Singleton on a @Provides signals that this dependency is tied to the Singleton lifecycle, for that lifecycle to exists you need to annotate the component with the same lifecycle

<@U18E0PY49>: You have an @Inject on the Database. You are also providing ut in the module. Apparently, dagger is picking the one on the Database hence the reason for the multiple instance
You can either remove the @Inject on Database entirely, and it will work or you can remove the module provided instance and add a @Singleton to the Database class

`NestedScrollView` is a self-documenting class :joy:

I need to create a ViewGroup which plays nicely inside of a coordinator layout, but contains a recyclerview and another child.. and when the recycler view is at the top but you pull down, you would reveal that other child until it’s fully visible before allowing the coordinator layout to do its work
hahaha, yeah, it’s _so_ clear  (not)
Something something custom scrolling behaviour
It's a pain

well the real hierarchy is something like this:
```CoordinatorLayout
   AppBarLayout
   ViewPager
     Fragment
       My custom viewgroup
         Child to show/hide
         RecyclerView
     Fragment
     Fragment```
so a coordinatorlayout behavior wouldn’t really work
because the view that needs to do the show/hide nonsense is hidden inside the fragment
designers…. they love to make life difficult for engineers
Yeh I made my own layout for this specific purpose
ooh, is it open source?
No, unfortunately it’s in a repository I no longer have access to...

<@U1KBFNA4R>: in the root project

```.				build

.git				gradle
.gradle				gradle.properties
.idea				local.properties
README.md			settings.gradle
app
```

attachments.title: Getting a Result from an Activity | Android Developers
attachments.text: Starting another activity doesn&#39;t have to be one-way. You can also start another activity and receive a result back. To receive a result, call startActivityForResult() (instead of startActivity()). For example, your app can start a camera app and …
